brief_summary.textblock:
This study is conducted in Asia. The aim of this non-interventional study is to evaluate the
      current status of diabetes management, control, and complications in diabetic subjects in
      Sri Lanka.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Cross-Sectional Survey to Evaluate Diabetes Management, Control, Complications, Psychosocial Aspects of Patients With Type 2 Diabetes in Sri Lanka

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  People with type 2 diabetes mellitus (DM) who are being treated, with any of the
             non-pharmacological or pharmacological options, at a particular centre for at least 1
             year and who have visited the centre within the last 3-6 months

          -  Patients willing to sign informed consent form

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Previous participation in this study

          -  Unable to comply with protocol requirements

          -  Confirmed or suspected pregnancy

study_pop.textblock:
People having been treated for at least a year are eligible for the study. The selection
        of the patients will be done randomly by the individual physician involved in the study.

intervention.description: Patients will fill out a questionnaire by interview.

clinical_study.official_title: A Cross-Sectional Survey to Evaluate Diabetes Management, Control, Complications, Psychosocial Aspects of Patients With Type 2 Diabetes in Sri Lanka

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients having HbA1c ((Glycosylated Haemoglobin) as measured during survey) less than 7%
primary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluated at the first visit (only one study visit)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) of patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluated at the first visit (only one study visit)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Postprandial Plasma Glucose (PPG) of patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluated at the first visit (only one study visit)
